classes.documentation: The PAYMENT SCHEDULE Property Class is used by all products which have amounts billed (i.e. made due) or capitalised. This component is used to define scheduled payment events with respect to different payment properties. The schedules of the payment can be based on a frequency or adhoc dates, depending on this definition payment end date is arrived. One can define number of days prior to the actual payments when the bill needs to be produced. Each T24 product defined and processed in AA can have a single PAYMENT SCHEDULE Property defined.
classes.name: AA_SIM_PAYMENT_SCHEDULE

properties.documentation: The key to the arrangement property condition. The key is comprised of the following components (delimited by a "-"):Arrangement IdProperty name>Effective Date
properties.name: ARRANGEMENT_KEY

properties.documentation: The activity that caused this arrangement property to be updated.The activity is taken from the underlying AA.ARRANGEMENT.ACTIVITY request that caused the record to be modified
properties.name: ACTIVITY

properties.documentation: The base date is an Arrangement Activity date (e.g. ‘arrangement start’, ‘first disbursement’, etc.) which will be used during automatic payment date generation. Validation Rules Input allowed should be either APPROVED, CONTRACT, DISBURSE or VALUE. Currently the only option allowed is VALUE. The rest would be developed later.
properties.name: BASE_DATE
en
properties.value: Base date for subsequent event dates

properties.documentation: If specific amount (residual amount) needs to be collected at the maturity date of the term, we can achieve this either by actually defining the residual amount or by defininng a amortisation term. This field indicates the term for amortisation. The actual payment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term and not on the actual term defined in TERM.AMOUNT property of the arrangement. This calculated payment is then spread across actual term of the arrangement. If the amortisation term is greater than the actual term then we would be left with residual amount at the maturity date. Any residual amount must then be paid by the client on maturity of the arrangement. Input in this field is allowed only for Constant, linear payment types. The term can be entered as a number of Days (D), Weeks(W), Months(M) or Years(Y)
properties.name: AMORTISATION_TERM
en
properties.value: It indicates the term for amortisation

properties.documentation: If specific amount (residual amount) needs to be collected at the maturity date of the term, we can achieve this either by actually defining the residual amount or by defininng a amortisation term. The actual residaul amount can be defined in the field RESIDUAL.AMOUNT. Any residual amount must then be paid by the client on maturity of the arrangement. Validation Rules Standard T24 amount field in the arrangement currency
properties.name: RESIDUAL_AMOUNT
en
properties.value: Specific amount collected at the maturity date

properties.documentation: Indicates whether bills which have the same due date and are produced on the same date should be combined. In case of capitalisation (where we have two payment one is made due and other capitalised) even if bills combined set to YES, system would generate two separate bills. In another scenario where have one payment type to be made due and two payment types to be capitalised, then system would combine the those two payment types Validation Rules Input allowed should be either YES or NO.
properties.name: BILLS_COMBINED
en
properties.value: If bills with same due date should be combined

properties.documentation: If "Nothing" is selected in field RECALCULATE, a recalculation frequency should be specified. Example: a) M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. b) M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. c) M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals10 = 10th of the month d) 31 MAR 2006 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006 e) 31 Mar 2006 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006. Validation Rules Standard date format. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.
properties.name: RECALC_FREQUENCY

properties.documentation: This field denotes the activity that has to get triggered when there is unallocated amount. Validation rules Should be valid record id of the file AA.ACTIVITY
properties.name: APPLY_PAYMENT

en

properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: The activity that caused this arrangement property to be updated.The activity is taken from the underlying AA.ARRANGEMENT.ACTIVITY request that caused the record to be modified
properties.name: ACTION

properties.documentation: T24 provides a mechanism (AA.PAYMENT.TYPE) by which users can define standard payment types that can be used by a product. For example Annuity or Linear. The Payment types defined should be a valid record id of the file AA.PAYMENT.TYPE.
properties.name: PAYMENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: Once the Payment Type has been specified, the user can specify whether the amount will be Due (to or from the customer) or Capitalised. Validation Rules Input allowed should be either CAPITALISE or DUE.
properties.name: PAYMENT_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field indicates the frequency at which the payments will be made due. The actual payment date moves forward or backward depending on the values in the fields DATE.ADJUSTMENT and DATE.CONVENTION. One can also define a holiday period for the payment with the combination of the fields START.DATE, NO.OF.PAYMENTS and PAYMENT.FREQUENCY. Example: a) M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. b) M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. c) M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals10 = 10th of the month d) 31 MAR 2006 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006 e) 31 Mar 2006 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006. Validation Rules The frequency is specified as a T24 Recurrence field. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.
properties.name: PAYMENT_FREQ

properties.documentation: For each Payment definition the user must specify the Properties with amounts to be paid. This field is part of a multi value set with field DUE.FREQ. The property defined should match with the allowed property class defined for the payment type. Validation Rules Input must be a valid record from AA.PROPERTY.
properties.name: PROPERTY

properties.documentation: Indicates the actual frequency when the payment needs to be made due. Due frequency is defined for each payment property under a payment type. Payment frequency is defaulted when due frequency is null. Generally both payment and due frequency has same value. When multiple properties are defined for a given payment type, due frequency of one of the property can de different from the payment frequency. Example: a) M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. b) M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. c) M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals10 = 10th of the month d) 31 MAR 2006 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006 e) 31 Mar 2006 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006. Validation Rules Standard T24 Recurrence frequency field Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.
properties.name: DUE_FREQ

properties.documentation: This field allows the user to define a percentage that would be applied on the outstanding balances and made due. Only the percentage of the amount would be issued in the bill and Made due. The remaining amount would remain on their respective balances and any further calculation would be based on this balance. Validation rule: Would only be allowed for ACCOUNT and INTEREST properties. The payment type should be belong to CALCULATED type with the CALC.TYPE set as ACTUAL. Should be in the range of 0 to 100
properties.name: PERCENTAGE

properties.documentation: This field indicates the actual payment start date. If Start date is mentioned then the payment frequecy if specified is applied on the start date else it is defaulted from the Base Date. Additionally an End Date or a Number of Payments can be specified to indicate to T24 when the payments should terminate. Adhoc payment dates can be defined by expanding the multivalue sets and defining the dates in the field START.DATE. Payment and Due Frequency needs to be null. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with END.DATE, NUM.PAYMENTS and ACTUAL.AMT. Validation Rules Must be a valid date.
properties.name: START_DATE

properties.documentation: If a frequency has been specified the user can specify a Start Date or it can be defaulted from the Base Date. Additionally an End Date or a Number of Payments can be specified to indicate to T24 when the payments should terminate. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, NUM.PAYMENTS and ACTUAL.AMT. Validation Rules Must be a valid date.
properties.name: END_DATE

properties.documentation: If a frequency has been specified the user can specify a Start Date or it can be defaulted from the Base Date. Additionally an End Date or a Number of Payments can be specified to indicate to T24 when the payments should terminate. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, END.DATE and ACTUAL.AMT.
properties.name: NUM_PAYMENTS

properties.documentation: There can be two amounts for each payment definition; Calculated Amount and Actual Amount. A calculated amount is determined by T24 based upon the Payment Type and Properties involved. System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: CALC_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: There can be two amounts for each payment definition; Calculated Amount and Actual Amount. An actual amount can be entered by the user to override the calculated amount or manual payments. When adhoc payments are defined we need to define the actual anount for each payment date This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, END.DATE and NUM.PAYMENTS. Validation Rules 1-9 numeric characters plus decimal point and commas.
properties.name: ACTUAL_AMT

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the bill is produced for payment or for information only. Validation Rules Currently only option allowed is PAYMENT.
properties.name: BILL_TYPE

properties.documentation: By default T24 will create the Bill on the due date, however for products which require a Bill notice to be sent in advance of the due date, it is possible for the user to enter the number of days prior. This will result in the due amounts being projected and recorded on the bill. Number of working days prior to the due date when the bill needs to be produced is defined in the field BILL.PRODUCED.
properties.name: BILL_PRODUCED

properties.documentation: Field to state a list of activities during which payment schedule is to be recalculated. When those activities are performed, system would automatically recalculate the payment schedule. For example, the following Activity Classes may require a recalculation: UPDATE – CHARGE CHANGE - INTEREST CHANGE– PAYMENT.SCHEDULE CHANGE.TERM – TERM.AMOUNT INCREASE – TERM.AMOUNT DECREASE -TERM.AMOUNT NEW-ARRANGEMENT - by default calculates payment amount. For each component specified above, the resulting recalculation types must be specified in the associated field - RECALCULATE. Validation rules: More than one activity may be stated for recalculation. But there should be no duplication. Should be a valid entry in AA.ACTIVITY file.
properties.name: ON_ACTIVITY

properties.documentation: This field indicates which payment parameter to change when changes occur to payment schedule or when any specific activity is triggered on the arrangement.The recalculation types are: • Payment – the payment amount will be changed. • Term – the term of the arrangement will be altered. • Residual – the residual amount will be changed. • Nothing – the payments, term, and residual will be unchanged. In this case a recalculation frequency should be specified. This field is part of a multi value set with ON.ACTIVITY field. Validation Rules Input allowed should be either PAYMENT, TERM, RESIDUAL or NOTHING.
properties.name: RECALCULATE

properties.documentation: These are set of Attributes which define the names of the rule, which will be applied on certain attributes of property classes over a period of timeValidation RulesInput must be a valid record from AA.PERIODIC.ATTRIBUTE
properties.name: PR_ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: This is the actual rule value, which will be applied on certain attributes of the property classes over a period of time.Validation RulesInput must be a valid data type defined in the correspondingAA.PERIODIC.ATTRIBUTE.CLASS record.
properties.name: PR_VALUE

properties.documentation: When a rule is broken what action needs to be taken is defined here. Currently, the various options available are Error block further processingOverride Give an overrideInformation Record details onlyCAP the rule value is to be used as a CAP if the rule is brokenFLOOR the rule value is to be used as a FLOOR if the rule is brokenValidation RulesShould be one of the above valid options
properties.name: PR_BRK_RES

properties.documentation: Based on the PR.BRK.RES option selected, this will hold either an OVERRIDE or EB.ERROR id. By default the ids will be picked from the associated EB.COMPARISON.TYPE record. If CAP or FLOOR values are given, then the underlying AA.PERIODIC.ATTRIBUTE.CLASS should have this type defined in itValidation RulesInput must be a valid OVERRIDE ID or EB.ERROR ID
properties.name: PR_BRK_MSG

properties.documentation: Not used for arrangement level conditionsValidation RulesInput not allowed.
properties.name: PR_BRK_CHARGE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the application method that needs to be applied to the periodic rule charges.Allowed values areDue - The periodic rule charges are made dueCapitalise - The periodic rule charges are capitalisedNot inputtable at arrangement level
properties.name: PR_APP_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field denotes the application period for the given periodic rule charges.The periodic rule charges will be applied at the end of the period. If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately.Standard T24 period field.Not inputtable at arrangement level
properties.name: PR_APP_PERIOD

properties.documentation: System field - not used for arrangement conditionsValidation RulesSystem Field NoINPUT allowed -
properties.name: NR_ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: System field - not used for arrangement conditionsValidation RulesSystem Field NoINPUT allowed -

properties.name: NR_RESERVED1

properties.name: NR_STD_COMP

properties.documentation: System field - not used for arrangement conditionsValidation RulesSystem Field NoINPUT allowed -
properties.name: NR_TYPE

properties.documentation: System field - not used for arrangement conditionsValidation RulesSystem Field NoINPUT allowed -
properties.name: NR_VALUE

properties.documentation: System field - not used for arrangement conditionsValidation RulesSystem Field NoINPUT allowed -
properties.name: NR_MESSAGE

properties.documentation: No input and multi value field lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. For a subsequently dated property, the attributes listed in this field will appear in "Negotiated.Fields" and only newly negotiated fields will appear on "Changed.Fields"
properties.name: CHANGED_FIELDS

properties.documentation: No input and multi value field that lists the attributes on the arrangement property record that have been fixed and/or negotiated. These are stored when the arrangement level record is committed. When the arrangement level record is next used all items in the NEGOTIATED.FIELDS list will be maintainedOnce an attribute has been fixed or negotiated it will remain in negotiated field list on all subsequent dated versions of the property.
properties.name: NEGOTIATED_FLDS

properties.documentation: Contains the key to the accounting entries raised by the activity being applied to this arrangement property
properties.name: STMT_NOS

properties.documentation: Standard Override field containing override messages generated by amendments to this property
properties.name: OVERRIDE

classes.documentation: This file is updated during simulations when there are any simulated bills updated between the current system date and the simulation end date.This is only used for enquiry purposes to produce the schedule details for a simulated Arrangement contract.
classes.name: AA_SCHEDULE_DETAILS

properties.documentation: This field denotes the arrangement id for which the bill is generated
properties.name: ARRANGEMENT_ID

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment date when the associated payment types are due.
properties.name: PAYMENT_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represents the total payment amount for the payment type on the payment date. This is the sum of all property amounts for the payment type.
properties.name: PAY_DATE_AMT

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment type. The payment type defined in the payment schedule property for the given payment date.
properties.name: PAY_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field represents the method of payment. It denotes whether the payment needs to be made due or capitalised or for information only.
properties.name: PAY_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field represents the total payment amount on the payment date. This is the sum of all property amounts for all Payment types for the payment date.
properties.name: PAY_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: This field denotes the outstanding balance for CUR Account property as on the Payment date.
properties.name: OUTSTANDING_AMT

By default takes up local currencyEffective date - if the property class is dated

properties.documentation: T24 provides a mechanism (AA.PAYMENT.TYPE) by which users can define standard payment types that can be used by a product. For example Annuity or Linear. The Payment types defined should be a valid record id of the file AA.PAYMENT.TYPE.

The actual payment date moves forward or backward depending on the values in the fields DATE.ADJUSTMENT and DATE.CONVENTION. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, END.DATE and ACTUAL.AMT.
properties.name: NUM_PAYMENTS

properties.documentation: There can be two amounts for each payment definition; Calculated Amount and Actual Amount. A calculated amount is determined by T24 based upon the Payment Type and Properties involved. System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: CALC_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: There can be two amounts for each payment definition; Calculated Amount and Actual Amount. An actual amount can be entered by the user to override the calculated amount or manual payments. When adhoc payments are defined we need to define the actual anount for each payment date This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, END.DATE and NUM.PAYMENTS. Validation Rules 1-9 numeric characters plus decimal point and commas.
properties.name: ACTUAL_AMT

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the bill is produced for payment or for information only. Validation Rules Currently only option allowed is PAYMENT.
properties.name: BILL_TYPE

properties.documentation: By default T24 will create the Bill on the due date, however for products which require a Bill notice to be sent in advance of the due date, it is possible for the user to enter the number of days prior. This will result in the due amounts being projected and recorded on the bill. Number of working days prior to the due date when the bill needs to be produced is defined in the field BILL.PRODUCED.
properties.name: BILL_PRODUCED

properties.documentation: Field to state a list of activities during which payment schedule is to be recalculated. When those activities are performed, system would automatically recalculate the payment schedule. For example, the following Activity Classes may require a recalculation: UPDATE – CHARGE CHANGE - INTEREST CHANGE– PAYMENT.SCHEDULE CHANGE.TERM – TERM.AMOUNT INCREASE – TERM.AMOUNT DECREASE -TERM.AMOUNT NEW-ARRANGEMENT - by default calculates payment amount. For each component specified above, the resulting recalculation types must be specified in the associated field - RECALCULATE. Validation rules: More than one activity may be stated for recalculation. But there should be no duplication. Should be a valid entry in AA.ACTIVITY file.
properties.name: ON_ACTIVITY

properties.documentation: This field indicates which payment parameter to change when changes occur to payment schedule or when any specific activity is triggered on the arrangement.The recalculation types are: • Payment – the payment amount will be changed. • Term – the term of the arrangement will be altered. • Residual – the residual amount will be changed. • Nothing – the payments, term, and residual will be unchanged. In this case a recalculation frequency should be specified. This field is part of a multi value set with ON.ACTIVITY field. Validation Rules Input allowed should be either PAYMENT, TERM, RESIDUAL or NOTHING.
properties.name: RECALCULATE

properties.documentation: These are set of Attributes which define the names of the rule, which will be applied on certain attributes of property classes over a period of time.Validation RulesInput must be a valid record from AA.PERIODIC.ATTRIBUTE
properties.name: PR_ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: This is the actual rule value, which will be applied on certain attributes of the property classes over a period of time.Validation RulesInput must be a valid data type defined in the correspondingAA.PERIODIC.ATTRIBUTE.CLASS record.
properties.name: PR_VALUE

properties.documentation: When a rule is broken what action needs to be taken is defined here. Currently, the various options available are Error block further processingOverride Give an overrideInformation Record details onlyCAP the rule value is to be used as a CAP if the rule is brokenFLOOR the rule value is to be used as a FLOOR if the rule is brokenValidation RulesShould be one of the above valid options
properties.name: PR_BRK_RES

properties.documentation: Based on the PR.BRK.RES option selected, this will hold either an OVERRIDE or EB.ERROR id. By default the ids will be picked from the associated EB.COMPARISON.TYPE record. If CAP or FLOOR values are given, then the underlying AA.PERIODIC.ATTRIBUTE.CLASS should have this type defined in it.Validation RulesInput must be a valid OVERRIDE ID or EB.ERROR ID.
properties.name: PR_BRK_MSG

properties.documentation: Charge can be collected when the periodic rule is brokenThis field denotes the charge property. The property and its condition isdefined the product designer and validated during publishingValidation RulesValid charge property
properties.name: PR_BRK_CHARGE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the application method that needs to be applied to the periodic rule charges.Allowed values areDue - The periodic rule charges are made dueCapitalise - The periodic rule charges are capitalised
properties.name: PR_APP_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field denotes the application period for the given periodic rule charges.The periodic rule charges will be applied at the end of the period. If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately.Standard T24 period field.
properties.name: PR_APP_PERIOD

properties.documentation: Defines which individual attribute (field) has the negotiation rules defined in fields "Nr.Negotiable" through to "Nr.Message"Validation RulesMust be a valid field name within this propertyThis field is part of a multi value set
properties.name: NR_ATTRIBUTE

properties.documentation: Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.Validation RulesValid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -NEGOTIABLEThe value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.NON-NEGOTIABLEThe value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined togetherOVERRIDESpecifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.FIX-VALUESpecified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.MANDATORYSpecifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.
properties.name: NR_OPTIONS

properties.documentation: System Field - Reserved for future use
properties.name: NR_RESERVED2

properties.documentation: System Field - Reserved for future use
properties.name: NR_RESERVED1

properties.documentation: It is possible to define negotiation rules in EB.COMPARISON.TYPE.Validation RulesInput must be a valid record from EB.STANDARD.COMPARISON
properties.name: NR_STD_COMP

properties.documentation: Defines the negotiation rule that is linked to the field defined in "Nr.Attribute". If an attribute has a negotiation rule linked to it (in associated fields NR.TYPE, NR.VALUE and NR.MESSAGE) the attribute must be defined as negotiable.It is possible to define more than one negotiation rule for an attributeValidation RulesInput must be a valid record from EB.COMPARISON.TYPEThis is a multi value set of fields
properties.name: NR_TYPE

properties.documentation: Defines the value that links to the rule in field "Nr.Type"
properties.name: NR_VALUE

properties.documentation: This field indicates whether to raise error or override message when rule is brokenAllows only two values ERROR or OVERRIDEERROR error message is raisedOVERRIDE Override message is generated
properties.name: NR_MESSAGE

properties.documentation: No input and multi value field - lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. For a subsequently dated property, the attributes listed in this field will appear in "Negotiated.Fields" and only newly negotiated fields will appear on "Changed.Fields"
properties.name: CHANGED_FIELDS

properties.documentation: No input and multi value field that lists the attributes on the arrangement property record that have been fixed and/or negotiated. These are stored when the arrangement level record is committed. When the arrangement level record is next used all items in the NEGOTIATED.FIELDS list will be maintained.Once an attribute has been fixed or negotiated it will remain in negotiated field list on all subsequent dated versions of the property.
properties.name: NEGOTIATED_FLDS

properties.documentation: System field - not used for property conditions
properties.name: STMT_NOS

properties.name: OVERRIDE

classes.documentation: The PAYMENT SCHEDULE Property Class is used by all products which have amounts billed (i.e. made due) or capitalised. This component is used to define scheduled payment events with respect to different payment properties. The schedules of the payment can be based on a frequency or adhoc dates, depending on this definition payment end date is arrived. One can define number of days prior to the actual payments when the bill needs to be produced. Each T24 product defined and processed in AA can have a single PAYMENT SCHEDULE Property defined.
classes.name: AA_PRD_CAT_PAYMENT_SCHEDULE

properties.documentation: This field represents the key to the product level conditions of a property classThis field basically has three components seperated by a hyphenCondition idCurrency - if the property class is currency based. By default takes up local currencyEffective date - if the property class is dated
properties.name: PRODUCT_KEY

properties.documentation: The base date is an Arrangement Activity date (e.g. ‘arrangement start’, ‘first disbursement’, etc.) which will be used during automatic payment date generation. Validation Rules Input allowed should be either APPROVED, CONTRACT, DISBURSE or VALUE. Currently the only option allowed is VALUE. The rest would be developed later.
properties.name: BASE_DATE
en
properties.value: Base date for subsequent event dates

properties.documentation: If specific amount (residual amount) needs to be collected at the maturity date of the term, we can achieve this either by actually defining the residual amount or by defininng a amortisation term. This field indicates the term for amortisation. The actual payment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term and not on the actual term defined in TERM.AMOUNT property of the arrangement. This calculated payment is then spread across actual term of the arrangement. If the amortisation term is greater than the actual term then we would be left with residual amount at the maturity date. Any residual amount must then be paid by the client on maturity of the arrangement. Input in this field is allowed only for Constant, linear payment types. The term can be entered as a number of Days (D), Weeks(W), Months(M) or Years(Y)
properties.name: AMORTISATION_TERM
en
properties.value: It indicates the term for amortisation

properties.documentation: If specific amount (residual amount) needs to be collected at the maturity date of the term, we can achieve this either by actually defining the residual amount or by defininng a amortisation term. The actual residaul amount can be defined in the field RESIDUAL.AMOUNT. Any residual amount must then be paid by the client on maturity of the arrangement. Validation Rules Standard T24 amount field in the arrangement currency
properties.name: RESIDUAL_AMOUNT
en
properties.value: Specific amount collected at the maturity date

properties.documentation: Indicates whether bills which have the same due date and are produced on the same date should be combined. In case of capitalisation (where we have two payment one is made due and other capitalised) even if bills combined set to YES, system would generate two separate bills. In another scenario where have one payment type to be made due and two payment types to be capitalised, then system would combine the those two payment types Validation Rules Input allowed should be either YES or NO.
properties.name: BILLS_COMBINED
en
properties.value: If bills with same due date should be combined

properties.documentation: If "Nothing" is selected in field RECALCULATE, a recalculation frequency should be specified. Example: a) M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. b) M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. c) M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals10 = 10th of the month d) 31 MAR 2006 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006 e) 31 Mar 2006 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006. Validation Rules Standard date format. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.
properties.name: RECALC_FREQUENCY

properties.documentation: This field denotes the activity that has to get triggered when there is unallocated amount. Validation rules Should be valid record id of the file AA.ACTIVITY
properties.name: APPLY_PAYMENT

NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.

properties.documentation: Describes this condition record and is used for enrichment.This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the property condition in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered.Validation RulesUp to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: T24 provides a mechanism (AA.PAYMENT.TYPE) by which users can define standard payment types that can be used by a product. For example Annuity or Linear. The Payment types defined should be a valid record id of the file AA.PAYMENT.TYPE.
properties.name: PAYMENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: Once the Payment Type has been specified, the user can specify whether the amount will be Due (to or from the customer) or Capitalised. Validation Rules Input allowed should be either CAPITALISE or DUE.
properties.name: PAYMENT_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field indicates the frequency at which the payments will be made due. The actual payment date moves forward or backward depending on the values in the fields DATE.ADJUSTMENT and DATE.CONVENTION. One can also define a holiday period for the payment with the combination of the fields START.DATE, NO.OF.PAYMENTS and PAYMENT.FREQUENCY. Example: a) M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. b) M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. c) M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals10 = 10th of the month d) 31 MAR 2006 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006 e) 31 Mar 2006 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006. Validation Rules The frequency is specified as a T24 Recurrence field. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.
properties.name: PAYMENT_FREQ

properties.documentation: For each Payment definition the user must specify the Properties with amounts to be paid. This field is part of a multi value set with field DUE.FREQ. The property defined should match with the allowed property class defined for the payment type. Validation Rules Input must be a valid record from AA.PROPERTY.
properties.name: PROPERTY

properties.documentation: Indicates the actual frequency when the payment needs to be made due. Due frequency is defined for each payment property under a payment type. Payment frequency is defaulted when due frequency is null. Generally both payment and due frequency has same value. When multiple properties are defined for a given payment type, due frequency of one of the property can de different from the payment frequency. Example: a) M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. b) M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. c) M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals10 = 10th of the month d) 31 MAR 2006 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006 e) 31 Mar 2006 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31March 2006. Validation Rules Standard T24 Recurrence frequency field Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.
properties.name: DUE_FREQ

properties.documentation: This field allows the user to define a percentage that would be applied on the outstanding balances and made due. Only the percentage of the amount would be issued in the bill and Made due. The remaining amount would remain on their respective balances and any further calculation would be based on this balance. Validation rule: Would only be allowed for ACCOUNT and INTEREST properties. The payment type should be belong to CALCULATED type with the CALC.TYPE set as ACTUAL. Should be in the range of 0 to 100
properties.name: PERCENTAGE

properties.documentation: This field indicates the actual payment start date. If Start date is mentioned then the payment frequecy if specified is applied on the start date else it is defaulted from the Base Date. Additionally an End Date or a Number of Payments can be specified to indicate to T24 when the payments should terminate. Adhoc payment dates can be defined by expanding the multivalue sets and defining the dates in the field START.DATE. Payment and Due Frequency needs to be null. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with END.DATE, NUM.PAYMENTS and ACTUAL.AMT. Validation Rules Must be a valid date.
properties.name: START_DATE

properties.documentation: If a frequency has been specified the user can specify a Start Date or it can be defaulted from the Base Date. Additionally an End Date or a Number of Payments can be specified to indicate to T24 when the payments should terminate. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, NUM.PAYMENTS and ACTUAL.AMT. Validation Rules Must be a valid date.
properties.name: END_DATE

properties.documentation: If a frequency has been specified the user can specify a Start Date or it can be defaulted from the Base Date. Additionally an End Date or a Number of Payments can be specified to indicate to T24 when the payments should terminate. This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, END.DATE and ACTUAL.AMT.
properties.name: NUM_PAYMENTS

properties.documentation: There can be two amounts for each payment definition; Calculated Amount and Actual Amount. A calculated amount is determined by T24 based upon the Payment Type and Properties involved. System maintained(NOINPUT) field.
properties.name: CALC_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: There can be two amounts for each payment definition; Calculated Amount and Actual Amount. An actual amount can be entered by the user to override the calculated amount or manual payments. When adhoc payments are defined we need to define the actual anount for each payment date This field is part of a multi value set of fields with START.DATE, END.DATE and NUM.PAYMENTS. Validation Rules 1-9 numeric characters plus decimal point and commas.
properties.name: ACTUAL_AMT

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the bill is produced for payment or for information only. Validation Rules Currently only option allowed is PAYMENT.
properties.name: BILL_TYPE

properties.documentation: By default T24 will create the Bill on the due date, however for products which require a Bill notice to be sent in advance of the due date, it is possible for the user to enter the number of days prior. This will result in the due amounts being projected and recorded on the bill. Number of working days prior to the due date when the bill needs to be produced is defined in the field BILL.PRODUCED.

classes.documentation: This applciation enables users to define the standard payment types that can be used by a product. A payment type is required for every payment schedule definition.
classes.name: AA_PAYMENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: Any alphanumeric characters can be used to define the name of the payment type. Validation Rules Up to 30 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
properties.name: PAYMENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field indicates whether the payment type is ‘Calculated’ or ‘Manual’. The majority of the defined payment types will be defined as ‘Calculated’. During the setup of each arrangement it may be possible for the user to negotiate a different payment amount than the one determined by T24. For arrangements with ad-hoc payment schedules a financial institution can create a ‘Manual’ payment type which indicates that the payment amounts will be entered manually and not be calculated by T24. This field is Mandatory. Validation Rules Input allowed is CALCULATED or MANUAL.
properties.name: TYPE

properties.documentation: This fields denotes different types of calculated payments that could be applied. T24 supports four types of calculated payments: • Constant – results in equal repayments. This is used for ‘Annuity’ arrangements and requires both a Term Amount and Interest property to be specified. • Linear – the Term Amount repayment remains fixed over the lifetime of the arrangement. Optional properties such as Interest, Charge, and Tax may be included. The actual amounts calculated by these properties will be added to the fixed Term Amount repayment. • Actual – is used for repayment of calculated property classes (i.e. Interest, Charge, and Tax) and will be determined on each payment schedule date. • Progressive – On choosing this type, a progressive percentage should be defined in the field PROG.PAY.PERC. System will calculate an amount which will be progressing by the rate specified in PROG.PAY.PERC. Exactly same as CONSTANT type when PROG.PAY.PERC is defined as 0. Optionally user routine could be attached for this type. • Other – indicates that a user routine will calculate the repayment amounts. This field is Mandatory. Validation Rules Options are CONSTANT, LINEAR, ACTUAL, PROGRESSIVE or OTHER.
properties.name: CALC_TYPE

properties.documentation: This application enables the user to define a routine to calculate the payment amount. Input in this field is allowed when the field CALC.TYPE is equal to OTHER
properties.name: CALC_ROUTINE
en
properties.value: Calculation routine developed locally, if any

properties.documentation: This field denotes whether the payment type is a user defined payment type or system defined. for the system defined payment types this field is set to yes. All fields except description is noinput if the field SYSTEM.PAYMENT is set to YES
properties.name: SYSTEM_PAYMENT

properties.documentation: Defines whether the corresponding payment type to be extended after payment end date. Allowed value is INTEREST. Denotes only INTEREST property is cycled for the corresponding payment type. No cycling will happen after payment end date for CONSTANT payment types.
properties.name: EXTEND_CYCLE
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: This field describes the AA.PAYMENT.TYPE and is used for enrichment. This is a Mandatory field.
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: This field represents the mandatory property classes that would be necessary for the payments. The property classes entered in this field will be validated against the property field in payment schedule for a given payment type.Depending on the Calculation Type there may be rules as to the Property Classes specified: • Constant – both Account and Interest properties are required. • Linear – Account property is required • Actual – Account property cannot be specified. This is a multi value field. Validation Rules Input must be a valid record from AA.PROPERTY.CLASS.
properties.name: MAND_PROP_CLASS
en
properties.value: Whether bill produced for payment or information

properties.name: en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: This is a live file holding the bill information of the payment. Bills are generated prior to payments. These bills hold all the details of the payment and different status it would undergo. Bills are generated by the activity ISSUE.BILL. Bills can be generated online for the payments made online like activity charges, charges for periodic rules etc. Bills are generated during cob for the scheduled payment. Bills are generated prior to certain number of days before the payment date. The number of days is defined in the field BILL.PRODUCED in the payment schedule property. Either individual bills or combined bills can be produced for each of the payment types. This is decided by the field BILLS.COMBINED in the payment schedule property. Bill details is updated when the payment date is made due, aging, suspension, repayment.
classes.name: AA_BILL_DETAILS

properties.documentation: This field represents the id of the bill. The format of the bill is AABILL<nnnnn><xxxxx> where nnn is the julian date and xxxx is the auto generated sequence
properties.name: BILL_REFERENCE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the arrangement id for which the bill is generated
properties.name: ARRANGEMENT_ID

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment date. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: PAYMENT_DATE
en
properties.value: It Indicates the payment date of the bill

properties.documentation: This field represent the actual payment date. The payments dates can be calendar days or can be cycled forward or backward if the payment date happens to be a holiday. This is determined by the field DATE.CONVENTION in PAYMENT.SCHEDULE property Standard T24 date field
properties.name: ACTUAL_PAY_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represents the financial date of the payment. This field represents the value date of the accounting entries raised during the payment. This date can be cycled forward or backward to the next working day if the payment date falls on a holiday. This depents on the fields DATE.CONVENTION and DATE.ADJUSTMENT in the PAYMENT.SCHEDULE property. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: FINANCIAL_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represents the currency of the arrangement.
properties.name: CURRENCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the total original amount of the bill . Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: OR_TOTAL_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OR.TOTAL.AMT
properties.name: OR_TOTAL_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the delinquent outstanding amount. If the value in the field BILL.SETTLEMENT is BILL.TOTAL, the total outstanding amount is updated in the field DELIN.OS.AMT during aging. During repayment, the repayment amount is compared with the total outstanding amount of the selected bill and the difference is updated in the field. If the repayment amount happens to be greater than or equal to total outstanding amount, the bill is deemed to be settled.
properties.name: DELIN_OS_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in DELIN.OS.AMT
properties.name: DELIN_OS_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the total outstanding amount of the bill .Standard T24 amount field.
properties.name: OS_TOTAL_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OS.TOTAL.AMT
properties.name: OS_TOTAL_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the total outstanding adjusted amount of the bill .Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: OS_TOTAL_ADJ_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OS.TOTAL.ADJ.AMT
properties.name: OS_TOTAL_ADJ_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the advance payment made on the arrangement
properties.name: ADVANCE_PAYMENT

properties.documentation: This field represents the last date or the recent date when the bill was last updated. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: LAST_UPDATE_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment property for the given payment date.
properties.name: PROPERTY

properties.documentation: This field represents the original amount of the given property . This field is associated with the multivalue set of fields - OS.PROP.AMT, OS.ADJ.PROP.AMT for each multivalue of the PROEPRTY field Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: OR_PROP_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OR.PROP.AMT
properties.name: OR_PROP_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the outstanding amount of the given property . This field is associated with the multivalue set of fields - OS.ADJ.PROP.AMT, OR.PROP.AMT for each multivalue of the PROPERRTY field This is updated during MAKE.DUE activity Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: OS_PROP_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OS.PROP.AMT
properties.name: OS_PROP_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the outstanding adjusted amount of the given property . This field is associated with the multivalue set of fields - OS.PROP.AMT, OR.PROP.AMT for each multivalue of the PROPERTY field Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: OS_ADJ_PROP_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OS.ADJ.PROP.AMT
properties.name: OS_ADJ_PROP_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the suspended amount of the given property . This field is associated with the multivalue set of fields - OS.ADJ.PROP.AMT, OR.PROP.AMT for each multivalue of the PROPERRTY field.This is updated during SUSPEND activity if SUSPEND.OVERDUE is being set for the corresponding property. After the arrangement is suspended this field will get updated during MAKEDUE activity
properties.name: SUS_PROP_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in SUS.PROP.AMT
properties.name: SUS_PROP_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field is linked to definitions stated in ACTIVITY.RESTRICTION. On evaluating a rule, the user may decide to Waive the calculated amount and even though it is waived and no Accounting is generated, it would be recorded in this field for information and MIS purposes.
properties.name: WAIVE_PROP_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in WAIVE.PROP.AMOUNT
properties.name: WAIVE_PROP_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field denotes the reference number of the repayment made.
properties.name: REPAY_REF

properties.documentation: This field represents the amount repaid. Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: REPAY_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in REPAY.AMT
properties.name: REPAY_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field in conjunction with ADJUST.AMT denotes the reference of the adjustment made to the bill.
properties.name: ADJUST_REF

properties.documentation: This field represent the amount adjusted after the bill was issued. The arrangement could undergo changes which can alter the payment amount. These changes can occur after the bill was issued but before the payment is made due Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: ADJUST_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in ADJUST.AMT
properties.name: ADJUST_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field denotes the reference of the write off activity executed on a bill.
properties.name: WRITEOFF_REF

properties.documentation: This field represents the amount written off from the bill. Standard T24 amount field.
properties.name: WRITEOFF_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in WRITEOFF.AMT
properties.name: WRITEOFF_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the bill status. This field is associated with the field BILL.ST.CHG.DT and the last multivalue shows the current status
properties.name: BILL_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field represents the effective date of the bill status. This field is associated with the field BILL.STATUS. and the last multivalue shows the effective date of the current status Standard T24 date field
properties.name: BILL_ST_CHG_DT

properties.documentation: This field represents the current settle status. This field is associated with the field SET.ST.CHG.DT. and the last multivalue shows the current status
properties.name: SETTLE_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field represents the effective date of the settlement status. This field is associated with the field SETTLE..STATUS. and the last multivalue shows the effective date of the current status Standard T24 date field
properties.name: SET_ST_CHG_DT

properties.documentation: This field represent the aging status the bill underwent. This field is associated with the AGING.ST.CHG.DT field. The aging activity would update this field. The aging statuses are defined in the EB.LOOKUP file. When bill is deemed to be settled, that is DELIN.OS.AMT is zero, the aging status is updated as SETTLED and the bill is not considered for further aging if the field AGE.BILLS is set as BILL.STATUS.
properties.name: AGING_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field represent the date on which the aging status was changed. This field is associated with the AGING.STATUS field. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: AGING_ST_CHG_DT

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment type. The payment type defined in the payment schedule property for the given payment date.
properties.name: PAYMENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the bill creation date. This value in this field is equal to the effective date of the issuebilll activity. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: BILL_DATE

properties.documentation: This field signifies the type of the bill. The Bill types currently available arePAYMENT - Scheduled billPR.CHARGE - The bill generated for periodic rule chargesACT.CHARGE - The bill generated for activity chargesPAYOFF - The bill generated for pay off
properties.name: BILL_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field represent the date when the action FINALISE.BILL was triggered. Currently the functionality for FINALISE.BILL is in development stage. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: BILL_FINAL_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represents the method of payment. It denotes whether the payment needs to be made due or capitalised
properties.name: PAYMENT_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field represents the total payment amount on the payment date. Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: PAYMENT_AMOUNT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in PAYMENT.AMT
properties.name: PAYMENT_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment property for a given payment type on the payment date
properties.name: PAY_PROPERTY

properties.name: OR_PR_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OR.PR.AMT

This field is associated with the subtivalue set of fields - OS.AD.PR.AMT, OR.PR.AMT for each multivalue of the PAY.PROPERRTY field under a given payment type. This is updated during MAKE.DUE activity Standard T24 amount field

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OS.PR.AMT

After the arrangement is suspended this field will get updated during MAKEDUE activity
properties.name: SUS_PR_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in SUS.PR.AMT
properties.name: SUS_PR_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field represents the outstanding adjusted amount of the given property under a given payment type . This field is associated with the subvalue set of fields - OS.PR.AMT, OR.PR.AMT for each multivalue of the PAY.PROPERTY field. Standard T24 amount field
properties.name: OS_AD_PR_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in OS.AD.PR.AMT
properties.name: OS_AD_PR_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in WAIVE.PROP.AMOUNT
properties.name: WAIVE_PR_AMT_LCY

properties.documentation: This field gives the list of properties that are linked with info payment type
properties.name: INFO_PAY_PRP

properties.documentation: This field denotes the original due amount for the perdiem payment type property
properties.name: INFO_PR_AMT

properties.documentation: Local currency equivalent for amount in INFO.PR.AMT

classes.documentation: This is a central file which gives an overview of the account based arrangement. The information that is stored in this file are start date, maturity date, drawdown date, bills generated for a date, status of these bills, payment information, aging status etc. This is a live file and is created when a new arrangement is created. Every activity updates related information in the file.
classes.name: AA_ACCOUNT_DETAILS

properties.documentation: This field identifies the main Arrangement Contract number.
properties.name: ARRANGEMENT_ID

properties.documentation: This field denotes the date the start date of the arrangement. This field is updated when a new arrangement is created for the lending product line.
properties.name: CONTRACT_DATE

properties.documentation: This field identifies the start date of the Arrangement contract and is updated only for Account based products, i.e. where Product Line constituents Account property class as mandatory. The effective date of the "New" arrangement activity would be updated as start date of the Arrangement in this field.
properties.name: VALUE_DATE
en
properties.value: Indicates the date the Portfolios will be updated by the event

properties.documentation: This Field denotes the drawdown date of the arrangement. This Field is updated when a first disbursement activity is triggered for the lending product line.
properties.name: START_DATE

properties.documentation: Reserved for future use.
properties.name: DRAWDOWN_END_DATE

properties.documentation: This field identifies the first payment date for the Arrangement contract based on the defintion in Payment Schedule property class.
properties.name: PAYMENT_START_DATE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the maturity date of the arrangement. The maturity date is calculated based on start date and the term. In certain cases the maturity date can be defined directly in the TERM,AMOUNT property. This field is updated when a new arrangement is created. It can change when the activity LENDING-CHANGE.TERM-TERM.AMOUNT is triggered on a arrangement to change either the term or maturity date.
properties.name: MATURITY_DATE
en
properties.value: Indicates the Maturity Date of the Transaction

properties.documentation: This field identifies the overall deliquent status of an Arrangement contract. It would indicate the worst status of all the bills.
properties.name: ARR_AGE_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field denotes that when the next renewal is going to happened.This field is updated during the New Arrangement(If Change Product Property is attached to the Product)
properties.name: RENEWAL_DATE

properties.documentation: Updates the end date of cooling period by adding the COOLING.PERIOD specified in the TERM.AMOUNT property with the first funding date of the arrangement. Accrued interest will be reversed in case of redemption of the arrangement during the COOLING.PERIOD.
properties.name: COOLING_DATE

properties.documentation: The date on which the contract would get cancelled. Linked to the CANCEL.PERIOD stated in TERM.AMOUNT property. When the deposit is not funded/loan is not disbursed before this date, then the arrangement would be automatically cancelled. Would not be populated if CANCEL.PERIOD is not used.
properties.name: CANCEL_DATE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the Base date of the arrangement. This field is updated when a new arrangement is created for the lending product line.
properties.name: BASE_DATE
en
properties.value: Base date for subsequent event dates

properties.documentation: This field is set to "YES" when the aging status of a bill results in setting aging status of all the bills to this status. In Overdue property class if AGE.ALL.BILLS is flagged for an associated status, on reaching this status for a bill the status of all the bills would be moved to this status and ALL.AGE.STATUS would be set to "YES" to indicate all the bills moved status because of AGE.ALL.BILLS setting and not through normal deliquent processing.
properties.name: ALL_AGE_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field is updated as "YES" when the contract reaches the deliquent status when the interest accrued / earned on the contract is to be suspended, i.e. P&L reversed and posted as suspense.
properties.name: SUSPENDED

properties.documentation: REPORT.END.DATEThis field will be updated by the system in the following order:1) If Renewal Date (CHANGE.DATE or converted CHANGE.PERIOD of CHANGE.PRODUCT property class) is present then this value will be used.2) If MATURITY.DATE is present then this value will be used.3) If neither of the above then a NULL value will be assigned indicating a call notice contract.For reporting purpose this field will be utilized in the building of CONSOLIDATE.ASST.LIAB keys.
properties.name: REPORT_END_DATE

properties.documentation: The final date on which scheduled payments happen. This is computed from the Payment schedule definition of the frequency and is also governed by the tenor of the contract. Would not be populated if schedules are not involved.
properties.name: PAYMENT_END_DATE

properties.documentation: This field denotes the number of settled bills (Bills with BILL.STATUS = SETTLED and CAPITALISE) and it is used by AA bill processing to trigger archival process. The number of bills to be maintained in live file (AA.ACCOUNT.DETAILS and AA.BILL.DETAILS) has to be mentioned in I_AA.ARCHIVE.COMMON. When the bills settled count breaches twice the threshold value, system will trigger archival process. This count would be incremented for each bill that gets SETTLED or CAPITALISED and would be recalculated if bills are archived.
properties.name: BILLS_SETTLED_CNT

properties.documentation: Idefities the due date of the bill associated. The deliquent processing starts from this date and not from bill creation date. It also identifies the date from when the payment amounts are due.
properties.name: BILL_PAY_DATE

properties.documentation: Identifies the unique reference id for the bill.
properties.name: BILL_ID

properties.documentation: This field holds the Arrangement Activity ID of Issue Bill activity for the arrangement.
properties.name: ACTIVITY_REF

properties.documentation: This field indentifies the bill creation date for the associated bill reference. It can be different from the due date in case BILL.DAYS is specified for the payment type and will always be less or equal to the due date.
properties.name: BILL_DATE

properties.documentation: Defaulted to PAYMENT as of now and is reserved for future use.
properties.name: BILL_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field identifies the payment method associated for the bill, it is updated as, 1. DUE - When the associated bill (payments) is made due, i.e. expecting payments 2. CAPITALISE - When the associated bill (payment) is capitalised
properties.name: PAY_METHOD

properties.documentation: This field identifies the status of the bill associated. The status can be, 1. Issued The bill is generated and a bill notice is issued to the customer 2. Due The payments associated with the bill has reached the due date and are due from the customer 3. Age The payments associated with the bill are overdue and aging process has started, the actual aging status is updated in AGING.STATUS field.
properties.name: BILL_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field maintains the settlement status of the associated bill, it can be, a. UNSETTLED - When the bill is just been made due b. REPAID - When all associated due amounts with the bill is repaid c. SETTLED - When the bill amount associated with the bill is capitalised
properties.name: SET_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field identifies the deliquent status of the Bill associated. The deliquent status is updated as part of Aging activity and is based on the definition in Overdue property class for overdue bills.
properties.name: AGING_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field indentifies the date when the bill would be processed for deliquency as part of Aging activity.
properties.name: NXT_AGE_DATE

properties.documentation: This field identifies the date when the next chaser advice is scheduled for the bill associated.
properties.name: CHASER_DATE

properties.documentation: Identifies the payment type associated with the bill. Updated based on the deinition in Payment Schedule property class.
properties.name: PAYMENT_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field identifies the number of times the associated payment has been processed, i.e. crossed payment date / made due. It is used in relation with NUM.PAYMENTS in Payment Schedule property class to identify number of remaing payments to be processed in future for the payment type.
properties.name: NUM_PAYMENTS

properties.documentation: Property associated with the payment types. Updated on the date on which payment schedule property becomes due.It is associated with PAYMENT.DATE, ACT.PAY.DATE and FIN.PAY.DATE and gets cycled every time when the corresponding property becomes DUE.
properties.name: PROPERTY

properties.documentation: This field represents the payment date. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: PAYMENT_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represent the actual payment date. The payments dates will be calendar days, if the payment date happens to be a holiday. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: ACT_PAY_DATE

properties.documentation: This field represents the financial date of the payment. This field represents the value date of the accounting entries raised during the payment. This date can be cycled forward or backward to the next working day if the payment date falls on a holiday. This depents on the fields DATE.CONVENTION and DATE.ADJUSTMENT in the PAYMENT.SCHEDULE property. Standard T24 date field
properties.name: FIN_PAY_DATE

properties.documentation: The field uniquely identifies the repayment references made against the Arrangement contract, it is maintained as the combination of activity reference (Id) and the activity effective date.
properties.name: REPAY_REFERENCE

properties.documentation: This is an associated field with REPAY.REFERENCE and is updated with the bill references against which any repayment amount has been allocated.
properties.name: RPY_BILL_ID

properties.documentation: This field is updated as "SUSPEND" when the Arrangement contract moves to a deliquent status when the interest accrued is to be suspended.
properties.name: SUSP_STATUS

properties.documentation: This field identifies the effective date of when there is a change in SUSP.STATUS field.
properties.name: SUSP_DATE

properties.documentation: This field denotes that when the last renewal was happened.This field is updated when we trigger any Renewal Activities(like ROLLOVER, REST and CHANGE.PRODUCT)
properties.name: LAST_RENEW_DATE
en
properties.value: Indicates the date the Portfolios will be updated by the event

properties.name: en
properties.value: Indicates the Maturity Date of the Transaction

properties.name: en
properties.value: Base date for subsequent event dates
